The selloff looks mostly done around the $850 area, and since then price has been holding above $880‚Äì$890 without much follow-through lower. It‚Äôs not doing much, but it‚Äôs also not breaking down.

Currently, $900‚Äì$910 seems to be the key level. A clean push above that, and things can open up for the upside.

#BNB  LTF Analysis:  $BNB  is shaping up nicely with a clear bull flag structure on the 4H timeframe. After a strong impulsive move, price has been consolidating in a controlled descending channel, which is exactly what you want to see in a healthy continuation setup.  This consolidation suggests sellers are losing momentum while buyers are absorbing supply. A clean breakout above the flag resistance would confirm bullish continuation and open the door for the next leg higher. That breakout is the trigger ‚Äî once it happens, $BNB  becomes a solid long candidate.  Until then, patience is key. No breakout, no trade. But if $BNB  manages to reclaim and hold above the flag, we should see momentum expand quickly to the upside. This pattern shows sellers are fading while buyers are quietly stepping in. A breakout above the resistance would confirm the bullish move and open the door for another leg higher.  Until then, it‚Äôs a waiting game. No breakout, no trade. But if BNB reclaims that level, momentum could pick up fast. ÔªøFollow to stay updated  #Macro Insights#  #BNBChain#

$BNB IS TARGETING THE 900‚Äì910 ZONE AFTER DEFENDING THE 870 SUPPORT AREAüí•üî•


If you look closely at this structure, $BNB respected the major demand zone around 870 and printed a clear reaction from that level. Buyers stepped in aggressively after the sweep below support, showing that downside pressure is getting absorbed. As long as price continues to hold above 870, the market structure remains healthy and a gradual push toward the 900 psychological resistance is likely. This zone has acted as a pivot before, so a clean break and hold above 895‚Äì900 can open the door for continuation toward the higher liquidity areas.


From a trade perspective, this setup favors a long opportunity on dips near support rather than chasing highs. The consolidation between 870 and 900 suggests accumulation, not distribution. If price re-tests the 880‚Äì875 region and holds, it can offer a safer long entry with a favorable risk-to-reward. Upside momentum will strengthen once BNB starts closing firmly above the recent lower highs, confirming buyers are regaining control of the range.


Short Outlook:
While the broader structure leans bullish above 870, rejection from the 900‚Äì905 zone could still trigger a short-term pullback toward mid-range levels. A clear breakdown below 870 would invalidate the bullish bias and shift momentum temporarily bearish.
